captions.text:
Good morning John. My new office is set up
over here. We have the Games with Hank, and

over here, we have Vlogbrothers, and over
here is my actual desk where I sit. This is

just a picture of you. Oh it's your puff is
a bird. I'll put it full screen, so everybody
can see it.

Okay John, it's kind of easy to forget how
cool the things we get to do are. I get to

have a channel where I just play video games.
You get to have a fictional soccer team...
that helps fund a real soccer team.

We get to work in a new medium that, despite
what people who work in it say, no one understands

or knows what to do with. Crash Course is
now being used as a tool in literally thousands
of schools.

You got to hang out with Bill Gates, a guy
who would be the richest person in the world

if he hadn't given so much of his money away...
and just talk about the complexities of market
forces on rural agriculture in Ethiopia. What?

And in the last, like, four days, this community
has raised $260,000 to help people who don't

have access to clean water, get access to
clean water.

I spent some time this week watching those
donations come in, and the most common thing

people say -- they get to leave a comment
if they want to -- is "I'm sorry I couldn't
give more."

And I don't spend enough time thinking about
how amazing this is -- just the weird and

wonderful position that has been granted to
us by two things:

One: pure, dumb luck, and two: the people
who are watching this right now.

Just like I kinda get used to how I get to
do cool stuff now, people who are a part of

things or watch things forget that they're
the reason that the thing exists. By spending

time watching this video, you are granting
me power.

And it's kinda weird to me that in a world
of infinite content, where there's 30 Rock

and Breaking Bad and PewDiePie and cat videos,
that you choose to watch this. What-what-why?

Your time is a gift, and I am honored that
you give it to me.

But let's also have a little bit of real talk
here. I am still insecure. I still, like,

get sad sometimes. And I don't struggle with
depression, I don't think; I just have a normal

amount of sadness, and sometimes I don't want
to do stuff and feel unmotivated and undeserving
of the things that I have.

And I think that's rational, like, I don't
-- there's nothing special about me that means

that people should be watching me on the internet.
I don't deserve it, but the thing that I don't
want to feel is that I'm faking it somehow.

Feeling like you don't deserve success, being
sad sometimes -- those are normal, but they're

not really socially acceptable to talk about,
so I figured bleeehh.

More socially acceptable is saying, "I"m so
overworked, I work all the time and I'm overwhelmed!"
which I AM!

There's a lot of things we could be doing
with our time and resources... but I don't
know what to do. That decision is really hard.

It occurred to me today -- that's a lie, it
didn't occur to me; John actually said it

to me on the phone when we were talking -- that
I should just ask. You're the reason all of
this exists; what do you think we should do?

So I made a survey. You can rank different
things that we might want to do in order of

how much you think we should do them, and
then add if you have other ideas for what

we should do with the power of this community.
That's, like, why didn't, like, what's wrong
with me that I didn't think of that before?!

I have an amazing community that's supporting
all of the things we're doing, why don't I

ask them -- let you make the decision? I don't
want to! That sounds hard!

So yeah, I was feeling a little down yesterday.
That happens, I think, to everyone... I'm

feeling better now. On the list of things
that I am grateful for because of this thing,

that's pretty high up there. This is always
there for me, to be a thing that I need to

do to motivate me, to get out of bed, to make
a thing, to be a part of something... thanks.
John, I'll see you on Tuesday.

And sometimes giant balls just appear! It's
a whole new, like, space-time thing. Oh my
god, that was a big ball!

[Hank singing] Somebody once told me the world
is gonna roll me, I ain't the sharpest tool
in the shed. Ahhhahahaha...

Did you like that? You like Smash Mouth? Is
that better? So have you ever seen the movie
E.T.?

comments.author: Camille Williams

comments.text:
Dear Hank, I am a regular person just like you. I'm 22 years old now, I was 
declared a "Gifted Child" when I was in the 2nd Grade when I scored in the 
99 Percentile on my Standardized Test scores. They put me in Advanced 
classes when I was very young, because my intellectual needs are different 
from "general" people at my school.

This set me up to "develop" my smartness with video games, computers, and 
days upon days of sifting through Wikipedia articles. But along with this 
came many many hours of isolation from a social environment. I believe the 
social skills I have are not meant to cope with the "General" public's 
capacity. I believe people like you and I are in this Elite group of 
Regular nerdy guys, who's brains are so packed with stuff and stimuli that 
we'd rather logically analyze our problems.

If you're like me, sometimes you're spending hours upon hours googling 
solutions to just one of your problems and somehow find a solution to 17 
other problems, while never solving the original problem. So I ask you 
this, Hank, what is it that all of this science is helping us achieve if 
people like you and I cannot be in an environment where abilities like ours 
are allowed to flourish.

I graduated High School with a diploma, but I come from a drug/alcohol 
addicted and disabled poor family. I qualify for all sorts of Pell Grants 
and Loans, but in the State where I live, none of the Universities cater to 
my philosophical interests. I feel like people like us can make a 
difference without a degree or a peice of paper saying we know something 
about something, when you know something, I feel like you adapt your life 
accordingly to the new information you recieve. So, in a way, Universities 
and current institutions the way you and I know them are a limiting factor 
in what humans can achieve.

This is a new era where communication is dominant and transparency has 
become a demand. But at the same time, were I feel like I'm in an era of 
dissillusionment, because I've been able to change my situation. With all 
of the knowledge and skills I have, I don't have enough money to rub 
together and start a fire if you understand what I mean by that. But I do 
have knowledge, if the countless hours I've spent wasting my life away on 
youtube videos like scishow, vsauce, minutex, you name it, it has to count 
for something. But how can we transcend from learning to actively doing 
things for the greater good. That is my life goal, if I can die on this 
planet and know I left behind a footprint that at least steered a few lumps 
of atoms in the right direction, then at least i'll know my pursuit of 
knowledge was not in vain.

So, Hank and John, please keep doing what you do, keep inspiring us out 
here. Even if i don't see a bright future in my local community, it doesn't 
mean I don't see the bright future of the greater good. If there is 
anything I can do to help, I am free and willing to quit my day job as a 
Stagehand and figure out a way to help galvanize the pursuit of knowledge 
and happiness in other people like ourselves. You've already helped me so 
much I'm jumping at the chance to give back!﻿

Since I am a International Medical Graduate (IMG = Not a citizen of America 
+ I did my Medical School outside of USA) and I have proved my ability to 
learn by clearing all my US Medical Licensing exam ( USMLE Step1, 2 &3) I 
am stuck in this long and slogging process of finding a residency through 
NRMP (National Residency Match Program) which is a 7 month long program of 
just applying and waiting for interviews!!! I face many problems like even 
after spending so much on those expensive exams and application I cannot 
get any work, not even something like a physicians assistant!! How do they 
expect me to get my U.S. Clinical experience they keep asking for? Seeing 
the shortage of Primary care doctors shouldn't they reform this process 
ASAP!! I would like to know your thoughts on this. Thanks :)﻿

comments.author: Kira Flattery

comments.text:
+vlogbrothers  It would be great if you guys could make a video about the 
barbaric slaughter of dolphins that takes place in Taiji, Japan from 
September-March. Fishermen round up thousands of dolphins using sound 
barriers to disorient the pods out of their migrations, and into a hidden 
cove. Dolphins are selected by trainers and sold off to marine parks around 
the world, where they will remain in captivity being forced to perform the 
rest of their lives. The vast majority of dolphins that remain are then 
slaughtered in the cove. 
This doesn’t only harm the dolphins, but it harms humans as well. The 
butchered dolphins are later sold for food, but the Japanese government 
hides from the public from the dangers of eating the dolphins. Consumers of 
the dolphin meat risk getting mercury poisoning, due to the dangerous 
levels of the toxin within the animal.
This needs to stop.
To help please make a video about raising awareness to end this atrocity. 
Please tell people to watch Blackfish and The Cove!!!﻿

comments.text:
Hi! I am a new fan.  I was wondering if Hank had seen Fed-Up and what he 
thought about it.  It really freaked me out and eating only six teaspoons 
of sugar in a day(RDA for girls) is really hard, especially living in NYC 
where around every corner is something yummy.  Now, whenever I pick up a 
package I can't help but feel the evilness of the -um everything- because 
all the RDA's are there except there's none for sugar. It's just missing 
and I never noticed it before.  Errg, how did I miss that?  I am a huge 
label reader.  I'd really be interested in what you think, Hank, bc of your 
UC, which I wonder if all of our health problems are related to the insane 
amounts of sugar in everything. Sock it to us! You rock! PS. I am on my 7th 
day of trying to eat only 6 teaspoons and well...I am nearly delusional at 
this point with desire.  TRY IT! SO HARD! (boys are 9)﻿

comments.text:
I know this is a late comment, and you're most likely not going to see 
this, but everything you said between 1:50 and 2:35 ish in this video was 
absolutely incredible to me. You managed to sum up exactly how I've been 
feeling so much lately, it was like you reached into my head and spoke my 
words. And hearing it come from someone who I have always seen as having 
their life completely sorted, someone I have considered an inspiration in 
so many aspects of life is so crazy. It makes me feel so much better to 
know that not only other people, but other people who seem like they have 
it all figured out, that seem like they know exactly what they are doing, 
feel the same horrible sad, unsure, scared, undeserving, insecure feels as 
I do, and it being called completely normal, which it is!! Thank you so so 
much =)﻿

comments.author: J Rezington

comments.text:
I don't know you. The real you. But I watch your videos (and your 
brother's). I can tell you why I watch your videos...
It's because you're not "special" or "unique"... but then, who is? It's 
because you're a normal guy, who did something - which got the attention of 
thousands of other normal people (or abnormal, in their own way). And as a 
result of that, you ended up - accidentally - becoming some sort of 
figurehead for the "normal people" out there - the ones who actually care 
about the world, and people, and things. The people who often don't stand 
out - or at least, don't stand out in the way of changing the world (ok, 
perhaps some stand out a little when Comic-Con comes to town, but that's a 
different thing). What makes you stand out (and not. At the same time.) is 
the fact that you are still you: a normal guy: even with people watching 
and paying attention. And that makes a difference. Consider it a "force 
multiplier". Instead of you being able to just help 1 person; you can help 
that one person - AND point out an easy way that another thousand people 
can help another thousand people. People want to help other people. People 
want to know what's really going on in the world. But today, advertisers 
pay for the news. Political parties and news networks team up. Sometimes 
what we think is a charity ends up being a "scam"; or doesn't really make a 
difference. And people are busy. And what they really need is someone to 
help them think about things the right way, help them make a difference, 
where it matters most.
And that makes a difference. It still doesn't make you "special" - it just 
makes you you. And that's a good thing.﻿
comments.author: Andrew Baker

comments.text:
I feel bad for not donating money but I'm sorta poor, but Im glad 
nerdfightera is making people who need the basic get some of them :)﻿
comments.author: InfinityDream

comments.text:
Okay for some reason the survey doesn't work on my phone, but basically: do 
what makes you happy. I appreciate that you'd like to know what we value 
most, but your time is a gift too! I feel like the reason so many people 
are able to connect with you (both you and John) is because you do a lot of 
things you're passionate about, which in turn attracts people that are 
passionate about the same things. And I definitely agree with everyone who 
is putting the idea of some holiday time out there! With all the new media 
jobs, or maybe with everyone who's self-employed, taking time off can seem 
undoable, but it's so, so necessary to recharge batteries sometimes. 
Anyways, thanks for all the awesome things you do and all the work you put 
into it. :)﻿
